Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2019 11:57AM PaulaAmy wrote: I just came across Nancy’s story and feel so heartbroken about the adoption story and I was about to send her a message telling her what a legend she is after looking at all her treatment. I am so sad to hear that she has left us. This disease is cruel. Warm wishes from Ireland.
Posts.Title: Nancyh exbrnxgrl PaulaAmy

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2019 10:39AM PaulaAmy wrote: I am coming up for 5 years since stage 4 diagnosis. Lung lesions have stalled, bone lesions have stalled, liver lesions found 6 months ago. I am on Gemzar and I feel tired but still manage to get to the gym a few times a week. My onc is awesome and always has a trick up her sleeve! We can do this girls. Love you all üíò
Posts.Title: Anyone 5+ years with liver mets and ER+ Her2-? ShetlandPony PaulaAmy

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2016 03:32PM PaulaAmy wrote: hi....I am pretty much where you are. Stage 4 and just swopped from Arimidex to Tamoxifen cos my TM's are slightly up from 40 to 86, onco taking no chances. How has your journey been? My first cancer was in 1996 so I have travelled a long road. I went off this site for a while cos we were losing so many good people. Best wishes Paula.
Posts.Title: No Progression!! AmyJM SonnyB

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2019 01:33PM PaulaAmy wrote: Hi everyone. Firstly thank you for all your posts and the humourous comments, I really enjoyed all the postings. I have been stage 4 for almost 5 years and it’s 22 years since my first diagnosis of stage 1. To think I was scared THEN. What a joke stage 1 was, I was 38 and happy to wave goodbye to my saggy boobs that fed 4 babies! Now I am very nervous as I just finished 8 cycles of Taxol and it did nothing for my liver mets. Today I was swopped to Carboplatin and Gemcitabine, fingers crossed. My lung nodules and bone mets have been stable for that last almost 5 years but the liver story is scary. I am a healthy runner but my poor body is taking a beating and I have pain in my liver, no appetite and I am trying to keep my game face on for my children. So thank you for all your stories.....there is strength in numbers. Warm wishes to you all. Paula.‚ù§Ô∏è
